required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Sepsis After Flexible Ureteroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Sepsis After Flexible Ureteroscopy in Patients With Proximal Ureteral Stone by Using Preoperative Factors

brief_summary.textblock: Sepsis is a lethal complication of flexible ureteroscopy. The aim of this study is to identify predictors of sepsis after flexible ureteroscopy in patients with solitary proximal ureteral stones.

primary_outcome.description: sepsis is defined as the concurrence of infection and at least 2 of the following 4 criteria: (1) body temperature >38°C, (2) heart rate >90/minute, (3) respiratory rate >20/minute, and (4) leukocyte count <4,000 cells/μL or >12,000 cells/μL

intervention.description: flexible ureteroscopy is used to removed the stone. If a double-J stent was inserted pre-operatively, it was removed at the beginning of surgery. Rigid ureteroscopy was routinely used for ureteral dilatation before fURS. A 0.035 mm guidewire was advanced through the urethral and ureteral meatuses to the renal pelvis under direct rigid ureteroscope vision. A 14-Fr ureteral access sheath (Cook Medical, Bloomington, IN) was then passed over the wire to the ureteropelvic junction, and 7.5-Fr fURS (Flex-X2, Karl Storz, Germany) was performed through the sheath. Intrarenal pressure was stabilized by a pressure-sensitive pump (Shenda Medical, China). Holmium: yttrium-aluminum-garnet laser was used to fragment the stones. After lithotripsy, 6-Fr double-J stent was routinely inserted in all cases for 2-4 weeks.

study_pop.textblock: All patients are enrolled in Wuhan Tongji Hospital from January 2012 to December 2018. Patient data is collected from institutional medical record archives.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- history of fURS to treat unilateral, solitary, and proximal ureteral stones
- age ≥18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- anatomical renal abnormalities such as transplant kidney, solitary kidney, horseshoe kidney, and kidney duplication

facility.name: Tongji Hospital, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
